titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-57, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
Rule provides for consideration of. Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules on Wednesday, April 23, 1997, or on Thursday, April 24, 1997.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 18.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/16/1997--Introduced. Makes it in order at any time on April 23 or 24, 1997, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules, provided that the object of any such motion is announced from the House floor at least one hour before its consideration.
